page.title: 13The Watercress Line
page.content: The Mid-Hants Railway is a preserved steam railway which runs between Alton and Alresford in Hampshire, via Ropley and Medstead. The railway was closed by British Rail early in 1973,and was reopened as a preserved railway on the 30th April 1977. At first it was only operating between Alresford and Ropley. It has operated during the summer months each year since. When leaving Alresford the line goes through a deep chalk cutting which when first constructed caused local fears that a train might be buried by a collapse. In 1985 the line was completed through to Alton Station, where it connects with British Rail. The building of the extension from Medstead to Alton was the longest single extension ever built by volunteers, and took just one year.
